elpacPracticeSet.title: ELPAC Training - Listening Comprehension
elpacPracticeSet.description: Practice your understanding of ATC communications for the ELPAC exam

activities.prompt: What is the assigned heading in the ATC instruction?
activities.feedback: The correct heading is 270 degrees. This is a standard heading assignment in ATC communications.

activities.prompt: What is the clearance limit given by ATC?
activities.feedback: The clearance limit is FL350. Remember to listen carefully for flight level numbers in ATC communications.

teaPracticeSet.title: TEA Training - Structure and Vocabulary
teaPracticeSet.description: Practice your English language skills for aviation communication

activities.prompt: Select the correct term for the weather condition:
activities.feedback: The correct term is 'Severe turbulence'. This is the standard aviation terminology for describing significant turbulence.

activities.prompt: Complete the sentence with the correct aviation term: 'The aircraft is experiencing _____ due to the weather conditions.'
activities.feedback: The correct term is 'severe turbulence'. This is the standard way to describe significant turbulence in aviation communications.

elpacSpeakingSet.title: ELPAC Training - Speaking Skills
elpacSpeakingSet.description: Practice your speaking skills for ATC communications

activities.prompt: Record yourself issuing a departure clearance

correctAnswer.text: Cleared for takeoff, runway 27, wind 270 at 10 knots, temperature 20, QNH 1013

activities.feedback: Make sure to include all necessary elements: clearance, runway, wind, temperature, and QNH.

activities.prompt: Record yourself handling an aircraft reporting engine failure

correctAnswer.text: Roger, understand you have an engine failure. What is your current position and altitude? Do you require immediate assistance?

activities.feedback: Remember to acknowledge the emergency, gather essential information, and offer assistance.

teaSpeakingSet.title: TEA Training - Interactive Communication
teaSpeakingSet.description: Practice your interactive communication skills in aviation contexts

activities.prompt: Request a weather update for your destination

correctAnswer.text: Request weather information for destination airport. Need current conditions and forecast for next two hours.

activities.feedback: Use clear and concise language, specify what information you need, and include a time frame.

activities.prompt: Report a technical problem to maintenance

correctAnswer.text: We have a technical issue with the number two engine. Oil pressure is fluctuating and temperature is rising. Request maintenance assistance.

activities.feedback: Describe the problem clearly, provide specific details about the symptoms, and request appropriate assistance.
